definition: Fabi, first currency issued by the 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] in 1935, in use until 1948
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: The central bank official said those that are out already are legal tender.
sentences.chinese: 銀行表示已經流通出去這些錯幣已經是法幣了。

sentences.english: Now it is just “fiat money, ” backed only by the “full faith and credit” of the United States government.
sentences.chinese: 現在這些“法幣”是建立在美國政府的信譽之上。

sentences.english: By fiat, he means that it has value only because the Fed says it does.
sentences.chinese: 他指出，法幣的價值只因爲美聯儲說它可以。

definition: to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
Saudi Arabia (Tw), abbr. for 沙烏地阿拉伯王國|沙乌地阿拉伯王国
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
